example.eg: The game ended when the final whistle blew.
example.egtrans: 比赛在最后的鸣哨声中结束。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 决定性的, 不能更改的

example.eg: The winners of each heat of the competition will qualify for the final.
example.egtrans: 每场激烈比赛的赢家可获得参加决赛的资格。

dsense.name: final
dsense.guideword: US, often plural (last class exam before graduation)

example.eg: I took my chemistry final last week.
example.egtrans: 我上周参加了化学期末考试。

example.eg: I took my finals last week and am now ready to graduate.
example.egtrans: 上星期我参加了期末考试，现在已经可以毕业了。

example.eg: Here's the final draft of your speech, Mr. President - I hope it covers all the points we discussed.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 定稿, 终稿, 最终草案

example.eg: Don't worry: I haven't left you out of my final instructions.

dsense.name: final leg
dsense.guideword: (last stretch: of a race, etc.) (最后一段：比赛等)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最后一段路程，最后一站

example.eg: This is your final notice before your electricity is shut off: please pay your bill immediately.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最后通告, 最后通牒

dsense.name: final offer
dsense.guideword: (highest bid one is willing to make)

example.eg: This is my final offer. I won't pay more.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最终报价, 最后出价
最后的修整, 最后添加的细节, 最后的细小变动, 画龙点睛

example.eg: She spent the whole morning putting the final touches on her window display.
example.egtrans: 她花了整个上午的时间对橱窗进行最后的装点。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最后的装点, 最后的修饰

example.eg: At the final whistle both teams left the playing field, exhausted and muddy.

dsense.name: final year
dsense.guideword: (last 12 months of higher education) (高等教育的)

example.eg: Mary is in her final year and will begin college in the fall.

dsense.name: pay your respects to [sb], pay your last respects to [sb], pay your final respects to [sb]

example.eg: He went to the funeral to pay his last respects to his beloved teacher.
example.egtrans: 他去了葬礼，向他挚爱的老师道别。

example.eg: The townspeople were excited for the quarterfinal of the singing competition.
Unfortunately, our team lost in the semifinal.
